document.docAuthor: Gómez, Samuel, Corgosinho, Paulo Henrique Costa & Rivera-Sánchez, Karen I.
document.docTitle: Spinodiosaccus primus Gómez & Corgosinho & Rivera-Sánchez 2021, gen. et sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Proposal of new genera and species of the subfamily Diosaccinae (Copepoda: Harpacticoida: Miraciidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Proposal of new genera and species of the subfamily Diosaccinae (Copepoda: Harpacticoida: Miraciidae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México, Instituto de Ciencias del Mar y Limnología, Unidad Académica Mazatlán, Mazatlán, Sinaloa, México.
Dep. Biologia Geral. Universidade Estadual de Montes Claros (UNIMONTES), Montes Claros, MG, Brazil.
Posgrado en Ciencias del Mar y Limnología, Unidad Académica Mazatlán, Mazatlán, Sinaloa, México

Antennule (armature omitted for simplicity). B. Antennule showing armature. C. Basis of P1, anterior view. D. P2 ENP. E. P5, anterior view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The specific epithet comes from the Latin ‘prīmus’, ‘first’, and refers to the first – and type – species described for
Spinodiosaccus
gen. nov. It is in the nominative singular, gender masculine.

GENERAL. Total body length measured from tip of rostrum to posterior margin of caudal rami ranging from 510 to 695 µm (mean 605.4 µm; n = 13; total body length of holotype 695 µm); habitus fusiform, widest at posterior end of cephalothorax in dorsal view, tapering posteriad ( Fig. 11A ).

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 11.
Spinodiosaccus primus
gen. et sp. nov. , holotype, ♀ (ICML-EMUCOP-180119-57). A . Habitus, dorsal view. B . Anal somite and caudal rami, dorsal view. C . Habitus, lateral view. D . Left caudal ramus, lateral view.

Fig. 12.
Spinodiosaccus primus
gen. et sp. nov. , paratype, ♀ (ICML-EMUCOP-180119-64). A . Urosome, ventral view (P5-bearing somite omitted). B . Caudal setae IV and V, ventral view. C . P5, anterior view.

Fig. 13.
Spinodiosaccus primus
gen. et sp. nov. , paratype, ♀ (ICML-EMUCOP-180119-64). A . Rostrum, dorsal view. B . Antennule (armature omitted for simplicity). C . Antennule showing armature. D . Antenna.

Fig. 14.
Spinodiosaccus primus
gen. et sp. nov. , paratype, ♀ (ICML-EMUCOP-180119-64). A . Mandible. B . Maxillule (asterisk indicates two surface setae). C . Maxilla. D . Maxilliped.

Fig. 15.
Spinodiosaccus primus
gen. et sp. nov. , paratype, ♀ (ICML-EMUCOP-180119-65). A . P1, anterior view. B . P2, anterior view.

Fig. 16.
Spinodiosaccus primus
gen. et sp. nov. , paratype, ♀ (ICML-EMUCOP-180119-65). A . P3, anterior view. B . P4, anterior view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Armature formula of P1–P4 as follows: P5 ( Fig. 12C ). With outer seta of baseoendopod arising from setophore. Endopodal lobe triangular, reaching distal third of exopod; with small spinules along outer margin; with five elements – one outer and one inner apical and one inner subdistal long setae, and two inner spiniform elements. Exopod elongate, 2.2 times as long as wide; with spinules at base of innermost seta and on outer margin proximally; with six elements – three outer slender setae, two apical elements of which outermost one shorter and one inner seta.
GENERAL. Total body length measured from tip of rostrum to posterior margin of caudal rami ranging from 380 to 510 µm (mean 455 µm; n = 8; total body length of allotype 510 µm).
SEXUAL DIMORPHISM. Expressed in ventral somatic ornamentation (see above), antennule, and basis of P1, P2 ENP, P5 and P6.
ANTENNA, MANDIBLE, MAXILLULE, MAXILLA AND MAXILLIPED (not shown). As in female.
P3 AND P4 (not shown). As in female.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 17.
Spinodiosaccus primus
gen. et sp. nov. A . Allotype, ♂ (ICML-EMUCOP-180119-58); habitus, lateral view. B . Paratype, ♂ (ICML-EMUCOP-180119-67); urosome, ventral view (P5-bearing somite omitted).

subSubSection.paragraph: Both caudal setae I spiniform in one female . One male possesses only one outer spine on P5 EXP.
